Package etithespirit.orimod.util.valuetypes

Class MutableNumberRange

java.lang.Object
etithespirit.orimod.util.valuetypes.NumberRange
etithespirit.orimod.util.valuetypes.MutableNumberRange
public class MutableNumberRange extends NumberRange
An implementation of NumberRange that can have its minimum and maximum set.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class etithespirit.orimod.util.valuetypes.NumberRange

    max, min, rng, ZERO

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor

    MutableNumberRange(double min, double max)
    Creates a new range between min and max.
    MutableNumberRange(double min, double max, Random rng)
    Creates a new range between min and max, using the given randomizer for the NumberRange.random() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • MutableNumberRange

      public MutableNumberRange(double min, double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new range between min and max. If min is greater than max, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum possible value to contain.
      max - The maximum possible value to contain.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If min is greater than max.

    • MutableNumberRange

      public MutableNumberRange(double min, double max, Random rng) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new range between min and max, using the given randomizer for the NumberRange.random() method. If min is greater than max, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum possible value to contain.
      max - The maximum possible value to contain.
      rng - The randomizer to use in the NumberRange.random() method.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If min is greater than max.

  • Method Details

    • setMin

      public void setMin(double min) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the value of min.
      Parameters:
      min - The new value of min.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the new value is greater than the current maximum.

    • setMax

      public void setMax(double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the value of max.
      Parameters:
      max - The new value of max.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the new value is less than the current minimum.

    • setMinAndMax

      public void setMinAndMax(double min, double max) throws IllegalArgumentException
      A method to set both the value of min and the value of max simultaneously.
      Parameters:
      min - The new value of min.
      max - The new value of max.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If min is greater than max.

    • isMutable

      public boolean isMutable()
      Overrides:
      isMutable in class NumberRange
      Returns:
      Whether or not this NumberRange is able to have its minimum and maximum edited.
